text: Ludwig van Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 4, in E major, Op. 7, also called the Grand Sonata, was written in November 1796 for his student Babette, the Countess KegleviÄ‡. The sonata was made during Beethoven's visit to the Keglevich Palace. Along with the Hammerklavier Sonata, it is one of the longest piano sonatas that Beethoven wrote. It is about 28 minutes long. == Movements == The sonata has four movements: == References == Piano sonata 004 Category:Compositions in E-flat major
title: Piano Sonata No. 4 (Beethoven)
